metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5390 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Linux kernel versions 4.9+ can be forced to make very expensive calls to tcp_collapse_ofo_queue() and tcp_prune_ofo_queue() for every incoming packet which can lead to a denial of service. Juha-Matti Tilli discovered that the TCP implementation in the Linux kernel performed algorithmically expensive operations in some situations when handling incoming packets. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-30-generic - 4.15.0-30.32
linux-image-4.15.0-30-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-30.32
